review: I am a fan of the Dirty Bird. However, I would recommend only eating in the bar and (I am really just about to say this) only when the male bartenders are working. Our last experience in the dining room was a complete dining out FAIL.  The times we have eaten in the bar while the female bartender was working, our service was sub-par and we had to ask several times for different parts of our order. On the other hand, we love Dillon.  He does a great job at making customers feel welcome, making suggestions, and making sure your order is right and you leave happy. I also highly recommend signing up for the Red Robin perks card.  We have enjoyed free appetizers and look forward to other bonuses.
Enjoyed the food and the service tasted good.  Was very excited that they had Sam Adam Octoberfest on tap; missing having the good east coast beer on tap.

I like Red Robin, in general. They are always very nice and they have a lot to choose from on their menu. They also have bottomless steakfries, which i am a fan of.  They also tend to do very well with keeping our tabs straight with big groups.

For a fast food joint I thought this was a pretty good place.  Especially because they really cater to allergies, specifically gluten! Went out for lunch with my co-workers.  Asked for the gluten free menus and had some yummy burgers.  I love that you can get a bunless burger. Id rather save the calories for the fries instead of the burger bun. There was a slight mess up on my order,but the staff here was super friendly and quickly corrected it!  The place itself is cozy and has its own old school personality. I cannot compare to other red robins as it was my very first experience. Would probably go again! :)

went here for lunch with friends. 1/service was ok not bad not good 2/wanted table -they dont like that and wanted me in a booth....had to insist 3/food was made wrong had to send back 4/kinda dirty needs scrubdown of restaurant 5/my friend had her credit card copied by one of the waiter/waitresses    and someone tried to use in southern california for 1300.00 worth of items    luckily the bank fraud dept caught it and called her to check on it.    WATCH YOUR CREDIT CARD AT THIS RESTAURANT-CHECK YOUR ACCOUNT    AFTER EATING HERE (Hopefully you wont get the bad server(s) who knows?)    where is the security guy?         not eating here again

We always go to Red Robin if we want some good fries and a good burger. We were sad when they took away the salmon burger and the Just a Quisadilla, but they put some other great things in theri place. Their beer is always sooooooo COLD too!

For a food chain restaurant/bar, red Robbin has some pretty good food. Lets talk about this trip, though.  Our hostess was sweet and helpful. She offered accommodations for our needs. (Baby) and made sure we were comfortable. Our server was also very kind and helpful, she helped us with menu questions and checked up on our table appropriately. Not annoyingly buzzing around us or the opposite, hiding in the kitchen or back like some employees actually do. Water was refilled :) Our food was good. Fries were HOT and fresh. Burgers were good, too. The size of the burgers are plenty enough to get one full and with endless fries- pretty good deal for your $. We were offered more fries before we had the chance to request, cool. One thing I may note is that I ordered a whole grain bun for my burger. It wasn't the same quality or freshness of the regular buns. It was a bit dry and crumbly. The only down side of our visit today.

This was my first time at this location. It actually pretty rare that I am even in this neighborhood. Had I never been to a Red Robin, this would have been my only time. It was about 3:30 and it didn't appear that I single table had been cleared since lunch. Wet, nasty, dirty, sticky tables no matter which direction you looked.  It also appeared that a shift change may have been going on as we had more than one server. No one was rude, but the place was filthy and the service was inexcusable slow based on the fact that there appeared to be an employee for every table in use.  The food was good and lived up to the flavor that I have come to expect from the dirty bird, but the appearance, presentation and politeness of the staff was nothing anyone should be proud of.

This is our favorite Red Robin location. It's never overly crowded or loud like the Southcenter location, and there's plenty of parking. We eat in the bar so we don't have to deal with kids. It also seems if we eat in the bar, you don't get the annoying upsell of expensive drinks and desserts, (with the bottomless fries, we never have room). It's also close to the waterfront, so on a nice evening, it's nice to take a walk after dinner. Great place for casual dining!

With the bottomless fries opportunity (so so thick cut steak fries), this place has the potential to be a diet wrecker.  This branch has friendly staff and is clean with plenty of parking so it's a good lunch option for those who live and work in the area of Des Moines.  It's a catch-all for business lunches along with Sharp's up on International for our company.  I always get the same thing so I can't speak for other peoples lunches:  the turkey burger without aioli.  Sometimes I eat the bun which is wheat and a nice touch, sometimes I don't, but I *never* get seconds on fries.

Red Robin is a place you know you can go to get a good burger, salad or sandwich.  That strawberry lemonade is always good and the buffalo clucks and fries are always a winner.  If that is not enough, how can you go wrong with bottomless fries. Service is usually pretty good and they have some interesting cocktails.
Good service on a busy Friday night! Burgers were also delicious. I like thus location over the "overcrowded" Southcenter one.

This was my first time at a Red Robin's and I loved it! We were greeted and seated immediately. We got onion rings stacked up and it was amazing! Not to mention I love their endless fries!!!! I forgot what burger I got but it was super delish. My husband got a regular burger and he loved it. I will be coming back again!

I love red robin in general but I absolutely detest this red robin location. let me tell you why: so my grandmother and I decide to eat here one Saturday afternoon and she and I both ordered our burgers and each of us took a couple of bites just too discover that both of our burgers were burned charcoal black! We asked the waiter if we could get a refund and if the cook can remake our burgers. So he comes back and offers half off our order but they wouldn't remake the burger! Are you kidding me???!!! You expect us to eat an inedible cheeseburger! So we asked to speak with the manager and he said the same thing but this time didn't charge us for the meal but charged us for our drinks and still wouldn't remake our burgers! We just walked right out and I later called corporate and complained and they sent me a $25 gift card. I will use that gift card at perhaps the tukwila or at the Bellevue location. Never again will I dine at this particular Red Robin location! You should only dine here if you enjoy eating burnt burgers and not getting another burger after you were served an inedible one!

I have always loved red robin and their royal burger usually me and my husband share one bc we get out of there so full. But our waitress was really nice. Also if don't want to wait to long I would recommend you to make a reservation because the waiting time is pretty long sometimes but we never the waiting which is good!! Their milkshakes are very good too me and husband share them we go through pretty quick!! Would highly recommend red robin and this des moines location did very good with their customer service.

I was not overly impressed with this location. We went on a slow day, yet service was slow. We waited a while to order and get served, which we felt wasn't typical standard at most other locations. Our fries were horrible and I feel that is their trademark. I think we will continue to go to other locations. I will say one point is this location was only open for a week so it could change over time.

Its better than McDonalds yet worse than any other sit down restaurant that serves a burger. The prices are on average $3 more than fast food and the ingredients taste like they could be used for fast food. The burgers need the red robin special salt to make them enjoyable. There are probably 100 better burger places within a 15 minute drive of this place.  The service is and always will be slower than acceptable. For whatever reason when this place is empty it takes longer to get your food than when its packed. If you call in an order for pick up and they say 10 minutes that really means 20 if not 30. Twice I have ordered pick up and the order didn't get put in until I walked in the door.  I have now officially sworn off Red Robin for the fore sable future. To many places sell burgers that are better at the exact same price.
Great good and service. Live the royalty program: Buy 9 get 10th entree free and you also get a free burger in your birthday!!!

One hour from Check In to food. Hostess seemed confused by a "party of five" and tried to put us in a booth because the table I could see was for "large parties". Food was standard REALLY good, but never got any refills on any drinks. We were on our way home from ECCC, and just too tired for poor service.

No, just no. Service was horrible. Waited for 20 minutes when it wasn't busy; server was dry and clearly did not care for their job at all.  Food came out after 45 minutes and was cold and bland. We asked for tabasco sauce and they brought Cholula...two different things. They forgot to bring our drinks. Took 30 minutes to get our bill. Just no.

Service was super slow even though they were not busy. Food came out cold, even the fries.  The offer to refill drinks and fries came way after we were finished, so that was kind of lame. It even took a long time to pay and get out of there. We won't be back.

Tonight we were seated at 7:15 PM.  We were ignored for 20 minutes.  The waitress mentioned to us on being sat, name Tamera, did not stop and say  hi, offer us a beverages, or even stop and explain that she was too busy to take our orders.   Several waitstaff passed by our table, so we did not know who our server was.  After waiting 20 minutes I finally stopped a waitress and asked who was our server, the reply was I am but I am way too busy, that we could go wait else where since I had told her how long we were waiting.  She also said that we should of stopped her sooner to get service.  Isn't it the server's job to make your customers feel welcomed?  Now I had thought we were in a restaurant, paying for  service, good food , and maybe a friendly server with manners.  No, instead we were met with bad manner, entitled feeling, rude female who definitely needs a big lesson in customer service.  IF you get this rude waitress Tamera ask for another server, this one will most likely spit in your food or serve it cold.   Management of Red Robin of Des Moines, think twice about keeping this obnoxious rude server or send her to customer service classes!  Tamera is bad advertisement for your company!  Oh, by the way I did graduate from culinary school and I know the servers responsibility.  So I am not being overly critical.

SLOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOW!  And a bit gross. We must have waited 15 minutes, in a not too crowded weekend lunch hour, for water and a menu.  We got the menu, then 10 minutes for our drinks. Food took another 20 minutes for below average food.  Overdone burger, hard as nails chicken spinach wrap, mushy fruit cup, mediocre shake.  The cold fries were just okay.  C- cheesecake. Filthy bathrooms with broken faucets.  Bring antiseptic wipes. Yikes!  Should be closed for a remodel and new manager hired, or just torn down!

Bad service here tonight. Very unfortunate for manager so I will not totally dis the restaurant. However our server has no business in the restaurant business. We were seated at 6:55 and food came an hour later. Drinks were messed up.
Food was OK, server forgot about us so no refills on anything... Not the first time... Def not coming again.

I love Red Robin! And I love how every one is just like all the others.  I do feel like the service at this one is usually always slower then others. But the staff has always been so nice and apologetic it has never bothered me.  My food has always been great. Never messed up my order besides not giving me crispy fries.  The real reason I come here is that they are super child friendly and bottomless fries!! I will keep eating here. It is my closest RR!  Sign up for their reward card.
super slow..... have kids and its been over 20 minutes sitting waiting foe food. 20 mins with kids is eternity if they are hungry.  still waiting.....
Too FOREVER! Arrived to a mostly empty restaurant(1140) no food til 1215... 3 tables sat AFTER us got food first. Prime rib dip was chewy fat and flavorless. I RR but I won't come back to this one!

I usually don't go to this Red Robin but we were at a tree lighting and this was close. Big mistake. Wow, talk about bad service. We waited to get served, waited forever to get our drinks, waited to get our food, waited to get refills and then waited to get our check. It was not good. Plus the food was missing some things, for instance, the blue cheese burger was missing blue cheese. The Peppercorn burger was way salty and my husband left most of it. The fries were not freshly made and tasted like it. We even waited to get ranch we had requested when we received our food. Yeah this place needs to work on a whole of issues here. Won't be back.

I do not recommend this location. The service was great; the best out of all locations, but the food was not piping hot! The food was just a little warm.  The taste was ok. I ordered my favorite royal burger with an egg and it came with bottomless fries.  The burger came with the egg sunnyside up inside, but the taste was ok, a little burnt and dry.  The burger felt smaller than usual; don't know if it's just this location or tough economic times.  The fries were a bit warm and crispy.  The refill was a little warmer, what can I say? I did not come here for the service; I came here for the food.  Well good service is good, but when I want a burger, I want to have a good burger and service secondary on the side. Also, the coke was low on syrup; needed a new coke package changeout. slogan for this particular location would be the opposite of YUM!

Red Robin has been a favorite restaurant of mine for many years.  The Des Moines location is the closest to me, though I much prefer the atmosphere of the Tukwila restaurant.  Every time I go, there always seems to be a larger than average number of children and it is quite crowded.  Some of the neon signs at the bar are absolutely blinding, and the TVs are not strategically placed so I found myself craning my neck to view them.  That said, the food is usually quite tasty and the wait staff are great.  Last time I went, my date was prepared the wrong burger (I believe the waiter wrote it down wrong) and he had to wait another 10-15 minutes for the correct one.  Much to my surprise, there was no discount on the bill to reflect the error.  I wish I liked this place better, but the atmosphere is quite poor.  There are no divider walls and the tables are close together.  It makes you feel like you are sitting next to all the other people in the room.  I much prefer other Red Robin locations for this reason alone, but this may be less important to other patrons.

This is a good franchise. They are attentive in the dining room  staff .  Food is as expected  I have ate in the bar a few times for lunch and find the bartender to be aloof to be polite and at times down right inattentive to diners.   I now stay away from eating in the bar because of her

I agree with other yelpers about inconsistent food quality.  Overall they do a decent job.  The staff in the dining area are usually friendly and attentive.  Unfortunately as another helper revealed, the bar staff doesn't cut the mustard.  Slow service in the bar with lackluster engagement.  Tip...go to the dining area if you intend to eat here.  The Federal Way location or the Tukwila location is much better.

Great food! Very baby friendly! Sometimes slow, but good service!  Went in on Friday night with the family and little one in tow and was surprised how baby friendly it was! They had no problem without stroller by the table, even though it made it kind of tight. I was very thankful for that because my son was sleeping in it :-) Our waitress was a bit busy and a bunch of people got their food before ours but no biggie.  Food was sooooo yummy, especially for a chain restaurant. Our onion rings were a little over cooked but that's how I like them. We all had burgers which were to die for! We will definitely be back...hopefully the food tastes the same.

I had my birthday here to day for lunch and my meal was free and I even got sung a birthday song Red Robbin style and also got my free birthday burger. Everyone there was great. Can't wait to go again.

So every six months I forget how dreadful this place is and I go there so I will remember.  Three visits.  Three crappy experiences.   Each one is a story in and of its self.  Let's see .  The first time there was rubber in my kid's milkshake.  Thankfully he was 8 at the time and picked it out of his mouth.  When the manager on duty came over they told me 1.  They couldn't figure out where the rubber came from and 2.  Don't worry, I didn't need to pay for the shake.  My kid took one sip.  Yeah I won't worry about paying the $5.  I'll worry about what the heck is in your food chain that you can't find black rubber.  (Check your blender!) Time two was just your run of the mill crappy restaurant experience. Time three was yesterday.  Mothers day.  I expected a wait.  I expected the food to be slow.  After waiting for an hour our food magically appeared when we stood up to leave.  Boom it was ready just as we lost our ability to wait with our three year old any longer.  That wasn't the worst part... A table was seated near us.  One of the members of their party was an autistic teenage girl.  The waitress was rude to her and her mother.  Telling them if they weren't ready to order then they'd just have to wait because she was busy.  The mom was fighting back tears.   Perhaps she didn't pick up on the signs.  But when I was paying my bill I pointed out to the waitress that the young lady was autistic and wasn't being rude.  She said " I know.  Thanks.  The hostess already warned me.  But thanks for the heads up."  It wasn't a "heads up".  I was politely giving her a "mind your manners."

My food was delicious. Piping hot fries. I love that their fries were bottomless. Reason for 3 stars was that service was PAINFULLY slow. When the waitress finally comes around she's sweet and helpful. Maybe bring a flag to wave her down with.

We've been ordering to go from this local red robin for a very long time, and it's always been what you'd expect of a decent Red Robin restaurant. If you stick to the burgers, fries, salad and simpler items, you won't be disappointed. We've also dined in and have had good service and food as well.

When will someone put this location out of it's misery? I haven't been here in over a year and now remember why. The kids and I were taking my mother in law out to dinner to get her out of the house. On a Friday night the restaurant is less than half full and we still had to wait for 20 minutes. When we do get seated, we are sitting in the kitchen even though like I mentioned before, half full restaurant.      This place is falling apart. The TV in the floor is trashed along with the trim, glass...Red duct tape covers a sign that evidently is no longer relevant. I've seen restrooms in Tijuana in better condition, seriously! Soap dispenser falling off the wall, sink scum all over, hot water handle that turns in circles and of course,massive amount of graffiti on the mirror.      Food was mediocre at best. Even the kids didn't like their food and they rarely complain. Drinks were empty most of the time.      I was ashamed that I took my mother-in-law there and horribly embarrassed.
This is one of the worst red Robins ever and if you sit in the bar expect even slower service I've cut this place off for good now .
The service was super slow on a Thursday night and the restaurant was only half full.   The food was good but it took us 2 hours to have dinner last night.

Really great experience with our server Noel. She was quick and efficient. I had so many modifications on my order and she got it right the first time! She constantly came to the table to get us refills and check to see how everything was. Noel also always kept a smile on her face. Good was GREAT and I am leaving full and satisfied!

Always the go to place for burgers done right. Undergoing a 'mature remodel' and not sure how I feel about the new look, but my Black N Bleu Burger with medium pink was delicious and just right on the fries as always.

My family and I had the worst service here:( We went in on a Monday for lunch, celebrating my Mother's birthday. The food was ok but everything else was a bust. I asked for the wing sauce which came out mostly just oil. When I commented about it to the server she brought me a bigger container of it to show me that's how it is. Just wasteful. I asked for a side of Bbq sauce and she brought me A1 sauce...not a big deal. I simply said this is A1 so she brought the store pourer of Bbq sauce to "PROVE" to me she was pouring Bbq sauce like she did the first time. Pretty sure that was very uncalled for and I know the difference between A1 and Bbq. She was very "put out" about having to do a birthday Sunday and never bussed the table which was a mess. After waiting about 20 minutes for a check, I went upfront to the host and told her that we've had the worst service ever and I would like a check and a box. The window we were sat next to was also dirty. Gross gross gross. Won't be back :-( please see pictures

I get frustrated every time I come here.  Very slow service.  I've only come 3 times to this location in 6 months because of the lack of service.  I wanted an appetizer,  however skipped it because no one came to ask if we wanted a beverage!  18 minutes upon arriving at the table,  we just ordered and our drinks too! Poor service!
Need Joe, only JOE, he is a wonderful waiter, an I use to be a waitress,  an bar tender,  so a weee bit picky I am.

We ate at the Red Robin in Des Moines, WA last night. I remember eating there when they first opened, and it was wonderful.  That is NOT the case any longer.  We arrived at 7:40 pm - not exactly the dinner hour rush.  I requested a full, large booth, and we were told we'd have to wait for 10 minutes, although there was a full booth available.  During the wait we both went to the restroom.  The restrooms were filthy and looked like they could be hazardous from the lighting hanging from the ceiling, and the sides of the stalls propped up with wood blocks.  I'm assuming they are remodeling the restrooms, but this is the worst I think I've seen in the U.S.  Finally we were seated, and instead of the full booth we requested, the hostess sat us in a half booth with a small table.  Strike one.   It was 7 minutes before the server even made it to our table to say "hello".  We requested water (plus an extra glass for my husband), some fries to munch on while we were waiting for our meal, and a chocolate shake to come out before the meal.  It took a total of 20 minutes to get our water, and then the server only brought one glass for my husband.  No shake.  No fries.  No silverware.  Strike two.   When we finally got our meal, about 40 minutes after being seated, we still had no silverware and my husband had to request more water.  The waiter left quickly and didn't check back for quite awhile.  When he did check back to see how our dinner was, my husband had already finished his meal.  It was after that, that we finally received the chocolate shake.  Strike three. I don't think we will be back to this location.

Though very busy we were accommodated with seating quickly. Our server Jordan was very nice and paid just the right attention to us. Food was typical red robin. I changed it up and had the chicken tortilla soup - tasty but small portion. My daughter had top line burgers and both ate all with sheer enjoyment. One had the pepper burger. The other the southern bell.

I like red robin. food great, service great, BUT the automated tablets on the table totally suck! Ours locked up and left us sitting stranded for 20 minutes! not OK. these machines put good people out of work. I will wait for real people next time!

Absolute the worse service I have ever seen restaurant was my really that busy from times we have seen before and still took 40min to get our food then it being wrong and one person in our group sent it back and it took 30min before we takes to the manager who was beyond rude about and disrespectful it's hard to believe that this place used to have good service and now it's so bad and the staff even worse this is beyond acceptable if I could give no stars I would

We walk in. The hi and welcome  with a big smile. Show us to our table. The sever was the and asking what we wanted to drink. We order. The sever came by to let us know how we are doing. The food looks good. And it was. The staff look  on us and ask us if anything we needed. Had a very nice time

It's got to be really bad if I'd rather write this review than eat the food. This visit 11/17/2015 negates our 3 previous 4-5 star visits. It was that bad. It's not that it was unusually busy for a Tuesday night. That was taken into consideration during our long waits. So, this place is newly remodeled. That part is good. The service was terrible. And I mean terrible. One of the top 10 worst experiences ever. So, our server comes to our table relatively quickly. I order a coffee, my wife a white wine. Server comes back a few minutes later and informs that a fresh pot needs to be brewed, no problem there. Several minutes later, she returns with my coffee and the wine. Takes our order, and is gone. 30-40 minutes gone. Empty coffee cup, empty wine glass. No server in sight. So, 45 minutes post order, I use the handy-dandy call server button on the automated table doo-hicky. Flashing red beacon blinking. This might get us a refill, right, WRONG!!! Several servers and staff walked right by us. Finally 10 minutes after pushing the button, our server carries some drinks past our table, clearly looks at the light. So, we figure she'll serve the table she is headed to and check back with us... WRONG AGAIN!!! She checks the table next to us and bails. I push the blinking red beacon to the edge of the table with our empty cups. Several minutes still. And finally. But, my wife now wanted coffee instead of the stale tasting wine she had before. The server seemed annoyed at this. Fancy that, SHE was annoyed. She the says "I'll go check on your food, I wonder what's taking so long". Yeah, I wonder. So, here it comes. I wish I could post the picture to this review but, you'll have to see it up there. I substituted sweet potato fries. And, that's what I got. A tiny handful of old, dry sweet potato fries. At this point I am ready to walk out. After sitting for an hour, that's what I get. I really no longer had an appetite. I pushed my untouched plate to the side. The server apparently noticed a few minutes later and asked if everything was OK. A few minutes later a fresh basket of fries was brought to me. But, apparently what was taking so long was our food sitting, getting cold. Mine was a borderline acceptable temperature but, my wife's burger was cold. She waited to tell me until after we left, knowing, I was on the edge of talking to the manager. I was irritated enough to want to walk out before the food came. After the fries, I really didn't feel this place deserved my money. One simple note to the manager. If you have staff unaccustomed to working on a busy night, actually train a TEAM. The fact that all of your servers have tunnel-vision and will not at least give a "thank you for waiting, I'll get your server" gives you as a manager a big FAIL. So really, this is your failure. The waits, and food mishaps could have been heavily softened by some kind attentiveness by the staff. This is basic customer service. It does not take a rocket scientist to figure that out. I won't be coming back.

I've been going to Red Robin since my kids were babies. They are now 11 and 13. We even know the waitresses who are friendly and ask us how we have been. This Friday we went to dinner. The kitchen took an extremely long time to bring our food and there was no one there! No wait list, no one in the dining room. They need to fix whatever is going on in the kitchen. My mother-in-law went to lunch today and ordered chili and it took an hour for the food to arrive. That is ridiculous!  We are not eating at Red Robin  again until they can fix this.  Very disappointed long-time customer.

My husband and I took our granddaughter to dinner at the Des Moines RR on Saturday, Dec 12, 2015.  The wait to be seated was very short.  Our waiter came by quickly, took our order and, we assumed, delivered it to the kitchen. We waited a very long time for our food.  The good news is that others who had been seated about the same time also didn't have food.  The excuse for the late food was that the kitchen was slow!!!!  When our food finally arrived it was cold.  My chicken was rubbery!  At the end of our meal we were served a sunday with two spoons for the three of us in appreciation of our long wait.  I told the waiter that I'd rather have a discount.  He said that he couldn't give me a discount because all of the other diners would want a discount.  Well, they all deserved a discount.  We won't be going back soon, if at all.  There are too many good places to eat.

Wow i thought i was the only one that thinks red robin in Des Moines is terrible. They sent me a gift card because i complained. I haven't used that gift card yet. Such a great location to.. Its just sad..

So I went in earlier with my kids and was seated somewhat near the kitchen, the wait staff was nice however I didn't even bother ordering any of us drinks. Within ten minutes of being seated all we hear is someone in the back (female) screaming at their staff. Way to go, no wonder no one wants to come here. All I heard was screaming about this and that to I'm fairly sure the kitchen staff nonstop. Had it been just loud talking it would've been one thing but full on shrill screaming like someone was losing her mind. I'd be amazed if no one quit. That is seriously no way to manage your staff no matter how bad/new they are. These people working here are not your children whoever that was needs to stop talking down to her people. I cannot spend money at a place that treats their people that horribly. The waitress apologized about this after I explained what I was hearing and was especially embarrassed customers could hear this woman in the back. If you guys want to know why there's so many new people in and out of that place I'm betting that's why right there. Restaurants need a good team and you can't form one doing that. Coming from someone who has ten years experience working in the restaurant industry I would NEVER allow this to happen. Not coming back.

Came right in the middle of a rush. Was told the wait would be 20-25 minutes. Wasn't close to that long of a wait at all. Once we were seated the waitress was right by. Once we got our food (well done Big Pig Out for me, delicious), both my wife and myself asked for an extra order of fries. We do this on most trips since they are bottomless,  instead of just bringing one like most servers would they brought us each an order. Very pleased with thw overall service.

I so want to like this place. But the food is salty, cold, poor quality. The service is always a test....seems like the billing process is silly with the computers on the tables.  Miserable stuff...don't bother. Their coupons are tedious and hard to use....love the location but that's all.
Terrible service. Decent food. Not worth the 20+ minute wait just to order your food. Take the drive to southcenter.
The food was bland and the service was less than desired.   For the price of the burgers, we would have been better off at Wendy's. Red Robin's quality has declined significantly over the years.

I like this red robin because its always less busy than the southcenter location. Plus it always appears pretty clean. The waitresses are always friendly and usually pretty quick with service -the new machines help with that cuz I can just push a button to call them to my table.  The burgers are good, if you go to red robin you know what to expect. And if they make a mistake they will gladly fix it.  I get Endless fries, with campfire sauce and a ranch every time. I do have to mention the horrible chocolate cake I had recently though. It was so gross I took one bite and spit it out and left the rest. The cake was dry and had to have been freezer burnt or something cuz it was just hard and lacked flavor. Really gross. And the waitress didn't ask if there was anything wrong or offer me a refund for it - I just paid for it and left it at that. Lol but I'll never order one there again and will always tell my friends how gross it was. I will go to red robin or fat burger if I want a decent burger for the 10$ price
My wife forgot her cell phone today at lunch, they found it and held it until I could pick it up after work. Much appreciated!

Thai place is great. It's my go to place when I don't feel like eating anything except burgers. The place itself is clean and neat, staff seems to be always on top of things, and this place is fairly busy but you get great customer service.
Waited over an hour to be seated and been ignored since will not be coming back any time soon

Absolute worst experience at a red Robin ever.  Showed up at 530 and left after 8.  Food was wrong and bad.  Service was terrible, but management was worse. Everyone was standing in the kitchen staring at the cooking staff instead of serving the customers.  We hit the server light when my wife's burger showed up burnt and it took almost 10 minutes for someone to come by.  No care or urgency by anyone.  The place was 2/3 full and there was still a long wait when we left.  We will not be back to this Red Robin.

I used to enjoy Red Robin but they have really declined in quality the last several years.  I try to not go there anymore but every once in awhile I'll get invited to go along with a group of people and I agree to go to give them yet another chance.  Each time I leave disappointed.  My last visit recently with some friends was no different.  In general, the food is just okay.  The prices are too high for what you get.  The service is average.   My last visit was a mess.  It was so bad that the management, server, and another staff member came over to our group to apologize in advance.  I just laughed to myself and knew we were in for an interesting meal.  The onion ring appetizers never showed up (they brought them out last, they were burnt, and then they gave them to us for free).  My friend's pre-meal salad never showed up (RR then boxed him up a salad to-go after he asked where it was).  The staff was fighting in the back.  It was bad enough that people could hear what was going on.  Our waitress admitted to having cried in the back office during that night.  It was just a crazy night there I guess.  I also wonder how we would have been treated if my one friend wasn't a well-known regular there.  I don't think we would have been given similar treatment, in my opinion. They did try to make good with free desserts for us and I ended up leaving a nice tip for the waitress as she tried really hard to make sure we had as good of an experience as we could.  I'll return to my usual routine of avoiding trips to Red Robin if I can.

We had lunch on a Saturday the restaurant was only about 50% full, and we waited about 55 minutes for our food to come. The plates were hot like it was sitting underneath the heat lamp for a while or just came out of the microwave. The burger buns on top where hard and the rest of the burger was cold. The burger was not as delicious compared to the same burger at a different Red Robin. The waitress was nice and friendly.
the server I had was having a bad night and she didn't let it affect her performance even though it was obvious the food was ok but the service was good

Had horrible, slow service. Me and my 5 year old waited for an hour plus, with constant reminders from the wait staff that our food would be there shortly. Finally just asked for the food in togo boxes and ate the hockey puck burgers on the way home. Called the manager after I had time to calm down and he apologized and promised to send me a giftcard comping me for the purchase. Has been over a month and still no gift card received.... gross.

Let me start with a couple things. One, I know it's Friday and they are busy. Two, our kids love this place. We live 5 minutes away-they see a lot of their classmates there and they like the rr menu. Three I was starving. Seating was fast, almost too fast. Drinks were quick. Then comes food. Ordered onion rings on the computer, they came out quick and were good. Then it starts. It took a little while to come take our order-understandable, they are busy. Then it goes sideways. 45 minutes for food is a long long time.  My fish was so over cooked, the batter actually cut the roof of my mouth. I had a half a cup of tartar sauce, not enough for all the fish, so I left over cooked fish uneaten. My salad was withered, scraps, nothing I would serve, nothing I would eat, but I couldn't eat it anyway.  My daughter had the corn dog bites. They were as dark brown as they could get without being black. I asked for ranch for her, she said she would bring it back. I gave my daughter my ranch from my salad, she never came back. (Why I couldn't eat my salad) My wife's burger bun was almost too crunchy to eat.  The waitress never ever came back to our table. Ever.  If I had to guess our good sat under the lights by the horrible waitress a long time, only a guess. Those darn computers allow them to not have to cone back to get your money. Well guess what, they won't get anymore of mine. We have had less than good experiences there before, but nothing like this. They are understaffed with unqualified employees and management that must be oblivious. It's deteriorated over time, we used to go every week. I noticed last night it's been two months. It will be a cold day in he'll before we go back. If I could give negative stars i would.

Slow service! Wrong drink order and the beer was bad on tap and the waitress knew it was bad because someone before us said the same thing? Seriously? Bad atmosphere mainly because people are unhappy who work here! Not good!

Did not have a wonderful dining experience here.  We were going to get some Chinese food for dinner, but at the last minute, decided that burgers sounded good.  So we came here, ready to eat some burgers and bottomless fries.  Our waitress was friendly and brought us menus.  It seemed to take a little longer than usual for her to come take our order.  But that was okay, it gave me extra time to go over the menu, which I always like to do. After ordering it took about 40 minutes, if not longer, to get our food.  I was starving by then.  I finished my burger, fries, and water in less than 10 minutes.  We wanted more water, and refills on our fries and sweet potato fries, but out waitress had disappeared after taking our dinner order.  We were finally able to stop another waitress and ask if she can put in an order of sweet potato fries for us. Another long wait, at least 10 minutes, and no fries.  Another waitress came along and asked if we wanted more fries.  We told her we had put in an order already.  She came back with regular fries, and we asked if the sweet potato fries were coming, which we had ordered.  She said there were no sweet potato fries out, which I'm sure the other waitress had never put in the order for us. So we finally got our refills of the regular fries and sweet potato fries, but by this time, I'm highly irritated because we spent so much time here waiting.  And one of my pet peeves:  no refills on the water.  I hate eating with no water. Our actual waitress still had not come around since taking our order, and we were definitely ready for the check.  I couldn't even pay using the electronic pad sitting on the table because it had other people's orders mixed with mine.  Took some time again to find another waitress to give us our check.  I really really regret not getting Chinese food like we had originally intended.

I come here with my family a lot hahaha. I really love their banzai burger (but I always take the pineapple out), and I love their burger with the over easy egg inside, omg... so good. It's such a great family place, and close to home too. Their service is always good to us! And they remodeled the place, it looks so nice?!

Rude wait staff, but pretty. I was made to feel like a tip waiting to happen when the lady was rushing me to cash out because her shift was about to end. I had not even ordered my food yet! Another time I went in and wanted a window seat but was told that was not possible by the lady who welcomes people at the front, I guess it's too hard for the waitress to go up two or three stairs if it isn't in her section. Then she punished me by ignoring me and later apologized for forgetting about me so yeah I forgive her and that's why I gave them one star. The restaurant is close to my condo, even then I won't be back.... Unless I feel like being treated like an ex boyfriend.

Good news: restaurant is remodeled and clean.  Bad news: our Server for service was horrible. Waited over 30 mins too long for our order, then no napkins or utensils on our table with no drinks. When we got our food, refills were given once, again no napkins. With 2 little ones and with my hubby everyone was inpatient and hungry! Never again here!

The best thing Red Robin could do for their customers is get rid of the self checkout devices on the tables. When it is not working, which seems like is pretty typical, the waiting staff freezes. We waited 20 minutes for a paper check after it was determined our self check out device was not working. At any other joint printing a paper check would be the simplest task, but it is near impossible at Red Robin. The attitude of the waiting staff made it hard to enjoy my meal and the wait for our check made me late to get back to work. I love red robin food which is why this is not rated one star, but if you want a good food with good service this is not the place to go.

I ate here the other day and I wish that I had gone somewhere else. You think you can rely on red robin for a good lunch and that was all taken away from me. First it took forever to get our food... I mean like 40 minutes with a dining room that wasn't even full. We had asked for fries before our meal and they came out the same time as our meal, which wasn't the point of me asking for them. We were in a rush after our email and went to pay with the self check out device. It wouldn't work and it took 30 minutes for our server to figure out what to do, she couldn't split our checks correctly and caused us to be late back to work. Red robin please get rid of these self check out devices they aren't doing you any good.

Having grown up in Des Moines I have been to this location plenty of times. Unfortunately, the last two visits have not been good. Each time it's taken FOREVER for our food to come out. Once the food comes out its average at best. The onion rings we had today we're literally dripping with grease.  Probably won't be visiting this location any longer.

So I think I've given this chain enough tries. Waiting here with kids for about 20 min. There are about 20 open tables. Amilz says they won't seat us because they don't have enough staff. Then said to wait another 20 min. Decent food awful service

I don't usually eat at chain restaurants and today just confirmed why. Spur-of-the-moment trip on Father's Day. Wasn't busy. Waitress was unfamiliar with the menu. Boca burger wasn't even warm. Broccoli was flavorless and cold. Overabundance of fries. Had to ask for silverware and napkins. Waitress did nothing but take our order. No refills or checking on us. Waited forever for the check only to be told we needed to use the technology station that the hostess removed from the table when she seated us. Then trying to figure the thing out was a production. Personal, human service is gone out the window!!

Don't bother.  I have tried for two years to see it get better.   It never does.   They have the slowest kitchen ever.  If you want Red Robin go to Tukwila.   You won't be disappointed like Des Moines.

I came here on 7-19 and received attitude from hostess who attempted to seat me on the bar. I politely refused to do the fact that it's faster in non bar area. She said okaayyyy with the whole attitude of being slightly annoyed. Don't understand the attitude. She showed me to my table where I was quickly forgotten; just glad I got the server with the elephant tattoo. She is fast, and friendly always. That being said my food was fresh appetizing and hot. This would've been the perfect Visit minus the hostess Came her 8-1 Waited about 8 mins when wait times were in exess of an hour. Success. Food fresh fast and tasty. Fried mushrooms always a delight Servers seem to be following the old core values of having fun!

The one thing this place have consistent of is worse service so we stop visiting as much as we use to no matter what time lunch or dinner.  My wife & I went in early to have drinks while waiting for the rest of our party.  They brought our drinks/rootbeer float @ the same time our guest arrived which was about 10mins later.   The other pattern I've notice is once u get ur food they ignored you but very attentive when it's time to pay or leaving the tip.

I'm so sad and super disappointed  because I've been here a few times before and have had great experiences and the food/milkshakes were delicious but the last two times my family and I have been here it's been very disappointing.  My burger was missing certain key items that make up that specific one and the salted caramel shake tasted as if it were plain vanilla with a drizzle of caramel on top.  Today we bypassed our other favorite burger joint to come here but unfortunately we won't be back to RED ROBIN since we've had two consecutive visits that were below average.  Not to mention the cost here is way overpriced for the food we've been served.  We will be going to the competition instead-Less expensive and waaaaay better food.   Sorry Red Robin, we've given you too many opportunities to make a more positive impact but no luck.

Whenever a restaurant or food serving place gives me undercooked food or food that should not be served that has made me extremely sick, i don't give them a second chance. I came in on June 1st 2016 after moving to the area the exact day. I had a group of friends help me move my stuff and we came down here to grab dinner and relax. Relax i say? Yeah i tried doing that but i was sick for 3 days in a row & that was NOT MY IDEA OF RELAXING!  This location has a bunch of young girls working here but they were all pleasant with us. Because they don't actually "Take your order" you instead just order from the table tablet (Wee technology), so you really have little interaction with them except for the food being served. The wait time was somewhat long and i made a mental note that the location seemed dark and dull. Not as lively as i remember red robins to be. So when we finally got our food, I don't remember the sandwich i got but i do know it came with avocados and we did have some fries but that was all i ate. The food tasted great but half way eating it i did notice i wasn't feeling well so i took the rest of my sandwich to go. Afterwords all i could do was take pepto bismol and lay down for hours upon hours. Then the next day i had pains in my stomach and threw up on the 3rd day. At first i didn't think too much of my Red Robins meal because i was still in the process of unpacking but by the 3rd day i understood what it was.  So i am never going to this location again & if i had seen all the one stars on yelp before i went down here, i would of avoided this place like the plague. Please take my warning & stay away. The one in Federal Way or Kent is probably a ton better with hopefully no table tablet devices. I like actually interacting with my server & being able to keep my food down or at least going out the other end.

Man if I could give zero stars I would.  The only good thing about this place is they just updated the looks of it so now it's not crusty, more sports bar-y. But nonetheless it's still dirty... Sooo idk this restaurant looking nice is even a "pro"  I used to go here for everything as a kid. After school concerts, birthday parties, family dinners. It was a place to get chicken tenders and play video games (which they no longer have btw) and I was a little kid. Didn't take much to please me then.  But now I HATE this place. The wait staff sucks so much, the food sucks even more, and I have had far too many "this will never happen again" moments here. Nuh uh this place deserves zero stars. The worst and last experience I've had here: my mom ordered take out for my family and I (just me, my husband, my mom, and my dad). I had just had a baby so I was hangry and tired and wanted a Groovy Smoothie from here cuz the couch was extremely comfortable at the time. Clucks & fries for my husband and I to split, a Groovy Smoothie, an order of fish n chips, and a bacon cheeseburger.  K she called it in and they said 20 minutes but we've ordered take out from them before and it's more like 45 min. So she went after a half hour and sure enough the food was not even ready. At all. She sat in the bar (that's also where you have to pick your food up) for a half hour before the dumbass brought her the food. She just took my moms debit card and handed the stuff and didn't say anything. She didn't have to sign anything which was weird and she asked the lady, "is this all?" and the stupid waitress told her yes. Note: my mom didn't check to make sure the order was right at this time. She was tired af of waiting and you really shouldn't have to check. But yeah. When she got home she was giving everyone their food but there were no clucks & fries :'( None. But guess what there was instead? A box with literally 4 fries in it. Four fries!! That was the dinner my husband and I were supposed to share LOL LOL LOL omg. Everyone else's food was correct. Except the smoothie I got was only filled halfway in one of their to go cups! And the to go ones are small as it is so I'm positive that's not how much you'd get if you sat down and ordered it. It's normally huge. But whatever.  She looked at her receipt and she was charged for TWO clucks & fries. But she received NONE! And she ordered only ONE! So wtf. She was pissed because she felt bad because it was food for me.. She went back and they gave her an order of clucks & fries but she had paid for two and brought in the receipt and everything. I'm sure she was screaming at them by then because they're so. fucking. stupid. here. I can't say it enough.  But some guy who was the manager came to talk to her and gave her a $10 gift card... Hahahahah like no. She took it and I'm assuming stormed outta there.  Bitch, please. That $10 RR gift card has been sitting on the desk and will probably get thrown away. We're never going back here.  *****this is just one horrible experience but there have been too many to even write about. Like the time when another table was given our order from someone random in the kitchen who brought it out and then after it was put in front of those people it was given to us. EW EW EW stop. Or the time my husband and I got food poisoning and could not stop puking our lives away hours after eating here. Nahhhhh. It may be one of the only big restaurants in Des Moines but just don't. I hate this place, don't eat here.*****

I've eaten here for about 20 years or so...I love their chile burgers,  but Monday, Aug. 1, 2016 at about 1:30 PM, the seating hostess (about 20 years old or so), was SO RUDE, and such a jerk to our party of 3, that we just turned around and walked out, then went to Huckleberry ' s instead. As we were leaving she was yelling ...goodby, thanks for stopping by, and cracking herself up...We won't be back, there are so many places to spend our money for lunch, we refuse to be treated so rudely.

My girlfriend and I go here about once every 2-3 weeks and enjoy the healthy options they have on the menu . They have very friendly staff, pleasant atmosphere, and well prepared food.  The few times we had an issue with something being made incorrectly, they quickly fixed it. I love the ability to pay at my table and their loyalty program is great.  My only request would be that they have more vegan options and work on the quality of the Boca patties for their burgers.  They often come out dried around the edge (I suspect they are microwaved to avoid cross-contamination), but I'm glad they have them on the menu as a healthier alternative to beef.  I also like the lettuce wrap instead of a wheat bun when I'm avoiding gluten.  All in all, I leave Red Robin feeling satisfied and happy that I went.

Had the worst service ordered drinks took over 15 minutes to get them when they came there was lipstick on the wine glass sent back didn't get a sorry or nothing then our food came we ordered chicken and came with salad she said what kind of dressing would you like waited 20 minutes still no dressing flagged the waitress down to get it and said just bring us to go boxes never did get the second round of drinks  never going back to that red robin again !!!!!

I've been to this location numerous times over the past few years and unfortunately it has gone down hill tremendously. The service has become absolutely terrible and I'm not sure if I will be returning after tonight.  Our waitress, Brittany, seemed to have a serious attitude problem. Right off the bat she was extremely rude. She constantly made faces as if she were annoyed although we did not ask for anything outrageous (unless you count substituting fries for macaroni and salad). She hardly came to our table and when she did she was very standoffish and also made a few snide remarks. When it came time to pay she seemed irritated that we had asked for separate checks, and I don't think one word was spoken to us after that. It was seriously awkward when she came to grab our cards and when she brought our receipts back.  Also, our cheese sticks didn't even have any cheese inside. So obviously the quality in food does not make up for the service. It really seems like this location has run its course. Disappointed.

Ordered a mad love without onion and other burgers to go. When we called before we came they never pick up. We had to wait for more than 30min and my mad love still had onion. Ok, that's fine since i can take it out myself. But what's even worse is after we got home and eat our burger just to see the meat is burned really bad and the bread is soaking wet. It is literally the most bitter burger we had ever ate.

Okay so first of all, I came here with a big party and the hostesses were glaring at us - not very nice. Then I came here again, this very day actually and I asked for my burger VERY well done so there wouldn't be any pink. And guess what? My burger was extremely pink. Like honestly I was so upset. Anyways I really do love red robin because I think their food tastes good (as long as my burger isn't pink and my fries are crispy) so I will continue to come back but I do think there are certain things they could improve upon.

Ate here last night with friends for our weekly dinner out.   I've been wanting to come to this Red Robin for quite some time for the burgers. What a mistake. I will say that our server Rena was absolutely wonderful in every way. But all the great service in the world can't turn swill into gold. I guess I'm not alone because when I came to this Yelp page to write my review I was besieged by a mountain of 1 star reviews. I won't get into details, but the food sucked and Rena would truly flourish at a better quality restaurant.  She was the only shining star. Cross this place off our list for good.

After complaining on Yelp! and emailing the corporate office I got a robot apology and a $15.00 gift card. I'm sorry I even bothered. I gave the card away. We used to spend a couple hundred bucks a month here, bringing 4 to 5 people a couple times a month. We have not been back since the last terrible visit. It's been months. I really liked your food, it's a shame.

So here's the deal, for the last year or so I've come here about twice to three times per week for lunch.  I was a regular.  My service was always good, food was usually good--I mean it's Red Robins, it's what I'd expect.  Plus they always knew me and knew I didn't want to sit at the bar and I like Root Beer floats.  Until lately. Then within the last few weeks, they went thru a rotation of employees and the young friendly staff at the hostess stand was replaced by a older lady who hates her job.  And I mean this woman really hates her job.  Every time I came in, she'd invite me to the bar and I would tell her I don't want to sit in the bar, I want the dining room.  Then (every time) she'd scoff at me for taking her valuable time and seat me at a table.  It got to a point that I felt like I was going to the Soup Nazi on Seinfeld.  Now I don't feel I should have to explain myself, but the reason I don't sit in the bar area is because I am wearing my company logo and I don't want people to be telling my boss I was drinking during lunch; secondly, I don't like high tables--if I do something stupid, it is a much farther fall to the floor from a high top table than a booth. But my last visit was the last straw.  I came in on 10/3/16 at or about noon.  The place was practically empty.  There was no hostess, standing up front, hating life, so I figured I'd just sit at the bar so I wouldn't have to waste the her time.  I sat for about 10 mins while the female bar tender was on the phone.  When she saw me, she came over 5 mins later, I got my float and then I ordered a bowl of soup and sweet potato fries (simple stuff right?  After all it's note even busy).  She left me for 20 mins and my bottomless float was no longer bottomless.  So for fear of running late back to the job, I had to skip my lunch, and leave.  I did offer to pay for the float and they said don't worry about it.  So at least my not-so-bottomless float was free. I'm going to give these guys like a month to fire the folks they got working in there or retrain them.  Then I'll come back and try again.

Really hit of miss with the service at this location.  The first time I came in the server we had was amazing!!!  She took our ordered quickly, checked up on us during our meal and made sure we had our check ready when we were ready to leave.   The last time I came in, we were seated for about 15 mins before our server came around.  She even helped a table that was seated after us first.  We had to flag down the hostess to let her know our server never came over.  After she took our order we never saw her again.  Super annoying because I was sitting there with a empty water cup and needed a box for my food.

I usually TRY to order carry out here but never get someone to answer the phone. A friend wanted to go for happy hour today and I was pretty reluctant because of the horrible take out service attempts. Today, we sat in the bar and had Brooke for our bartender. She was amazing! Checking in as drinks got closer to empty, making sure everything was good, etc. I had given up on them but she gave me a reason to try it again. 3 stars for past experience but 5 stars today. Thanks Brooke!
Food was good, service attentive, and great atmosphere. Looking for a quick bite and to not miss a minute of the game. Per request, they positioned us close to a TV. Always a great experience.

3rd times a charm? Nope. I ordered a vegan BocA burger vegan style and the 1st time they brought a burger with sauce. They remade without sauce but it was a garden burger which has cheese. The 3rd time they remade it I had to go so they boxed it for me and when I opened it it was a BocA burger but it had sauce. I spent $11 on this? The kitchen manager even came out and apologized. I know I'm a vegan a meat place but I have problems every time I go there  - they always mess up the order. The staff was nice that's why I gave 2 stars. But they can't put in an order right.
I used to love this Red Robin but, it has gone down hill the last 2 years! Alot of mistakes especially on the to go orders! The staff tries but the kitchen sucks!

Horrible! I called in and order for the business I work for. It took for ever for them to answer the phone I had to call in 5 times until they actually picked up. Order 4 burger meals , when one of my coworkers pick the food up he literally said he had 'to pull teeth' to get some campfire sauce and ranch. He also asked to get some extra fries with our togo order and they totally ignored him. When I actually got to eat it. My burger wasn't even wrapped all the way and my fries looked awful. When I opened the campfire sauce it was an even bigger disappointment there was no sauce in all 4 containers.

The Banzai burger is a staple of mine & even though it's not as good as it used to be, this one was better than the last. I do have to say that I'm a fan of the Mint Chocolate Brownie milk shake now. I've never had one but this time I had a free one and have to say I would have paid regular price for it. Now I'm going to have to eat less fries & save room for another shake.

Prompt seating and service. Fresh, hot food. And excellent waitstaff. Always slow getting drinks as everything not water comes from the bar so that's a rub, but again the waitstaff is always engaging us. Long wait times for getting a table if your group is more than 4.

Food was cold and not made according to menu, forgotten ingredients.  Manager argumentative for no reason other than he hates his job and doing it right.  Go to Elliott Bay for better prices and awesome food, hot food.  Or just save the trouble and hit McDonald's.
This is probably the worst Red Robin of all their chains always noisy slow service half the time the food's not even good

I'm sort of a sucker for Red Robin, esp since we have so many in the area but also cuz I don't mind their food. This location is handy in the south end and it isn't as crowded as the busier locations.  Ample parking and super easy to find, being right off the main road. Typical Red Robin menu here, their normal burgers, endless fries, specialty burgers, wraps, salads, etc. They also have a decent bar with some good top shelf choices.  Service is good here although sometimes slow when they get busy but that's expected. I watched a waitress deal with a problem customer very professionally one of the last times I was there. It was cool to see how they handled customers under pressure like that.  Overall yes this is a chain and yes it's another Red Robin but the location is handy and their food/service isn't that bad at all!

Went there a few nights ago the girl that served are table was awesome her name is Lori I hope we get her next time! she so happy in a good way I've never felt so welcome in a restaurant thank for the great burgers
Uh never again... What happened to the old Robin??? Place shouldn't be called Red Robin!

This is the only burger place that has a great variety of that you can put into a Gluten Free bun!  And their Gluten Free Bun is the best. This location has great service!  I called my order to go, it was ready on time.  I decided to eat at the restaurant and Jake the bartender was friendly, so relaxed and accommmadating.  He had by burger put on a plate with fresh fries, and just provided great service!  He recommended the campfire sauce for my fries, delicious and totally amazing! really enjoyed my experience!

We don't mind the food here. In fact, it's pretty decent considering it's a chain. We visit this Red Robin probably about once a month because our daughter frequently has swim meets in the area.  The reason for the 2-star rating is the service. It is consistently bad. Even though the servers are friendly, orders usually come out incorrectly or it takes forever, even when the place is empty. I hate hate hate when people don't write down orders because they almost always screw it up. For example, hubs asked for no guacamole and add avocado on the side -- he received burger with guac AND avocados on it, kiddo asked for cheese on her burger and it didn't happen, plus no side of ranch for me. This is typical of our visits here. I wish they could get it together so that we could feel better about coming here.

This was our first visit to this Red Robin and we enjoyed it.    We were greeted and seated promptly and the waiter showed up to take our order with a smile.      All our food was great and the way we ordered it.    My wife and I share the Banzai burger and for a change they did a good job.   When they make it the way we like it - pink center - and pineapple over the whole sandwich - it is delicious - as was this one. They replenished the fries on a timely basis and kept our drinks filled.    Overall a great experience and one of the better ones we have had from the chain lately.

We've eaten here 3 times and the turkey burgers are always so bland. They need more seasoning! Our Red Robin back home in Texas has great turkey burgers. The fries are great and customer service is good! Fix the turkey burgers, please!!!

We came here at 1 pm and ordered drinks along with a burger and pretzel bites. Not only did it take the waitress 30 minutes to get us our drinks (after we approached the bar twice), but the burger came out cold and the pretzel bites were hard as if they both had been sitting on the table for a while before being brought out to serve to the customer. We were very clear with the server as to what we expected in our order. However, from the appetizers to the main course our order was filled with negligence. Finally, when we were able to speak with the manger, Sam Walton, he feigned interest in our concerns and questioned our experience by expressing he had to view security footage to corroborate our story. Rather than taking any efforts to make the customer feel at ease, he continued to escalate the situation. Then we waited another 20 minutes with no response from Mr. Walton, finally another manager helped ease our exiting transactions. This was meant to be a pleasant experience for my sister's 30th birthday but it ended up being the biggest negative in our day. This has been our only negative experience with Red Robin's and we don't plan on returning.

If you go to the location, I recommend highly not to sit at the bar area. Service is really bad... took 6 min until someone acknowledge I was sitting there. After I finished my drink, I decided to move the cup to the end of my table where 9 times a server, bus, bartender walked by and didn't once ask if I need refill. When I asked for a refill for my fries, they didn't ask me. Second time I ask for refill, i sat for 15 min and had to flag another waitress... DONT SIT THERE!!! Btw don't try to call either... they don't answer the phone. I sat there listening to the phone ring constantly, nobody picked it up.

Went here tonight. My kiddos 13th birthday yes a teenager hanging around now.  I even had a convo with the server about how she had 6 birthdays today. After over 2 hours there waiting for table food drinks service.  We paid and hung around.. after watching our server chat with another table for 15 plus minutes, we assumed they weren't going to sing happy birthday. We've been going there for 6 years now, he always loves the singing and dessert. Man and on his 13th birthday. Yes I chatted with the manager who said simply. Yes that's not right.  That's IT.. six years assholes, sorry for language but I hate seeing my kiddo so sad..

Oh man.... best Red Robin experience ever! Kara was our server and she was nothing but awesome! She kept our drinks full, she came and checked in on us. She sent over a couple baskets of fries when we didn't ask and thought they were meant for someone else but I ate them and they were delicious with my campfire sauce. We ordered the pick two appetizer and I chose the cheese sticks and cheese curds. The cheese sticks were meh, but them cheese curds! Wow! I can eat them all day! Got so full on those and the fries that I hardly touched my crispy chicken salad! My boyfriend loved his bacon cheeseburger! Kara was quick with my to go box and cup for my iced tea which I thought was AWESOME! She even offered my boyfriend a cup of Sprite to go! I call that customer service. I can't wait to come back and hope to get seated in her area as she was truly exceptional!

This was our first and nothing happy about Happy Hour.  Only lite beers are on happy hour pricing, house wine and margarita?  Happy hour food is equally disappointing. only three choices.  We arrived at 3:30pm and there was a 20 minutes wait in restaurant?, so we went to bar.  Lidia was the best part of the experience  She did great, its just corporate let us down in the offers.   Hint 1: let them know if something is wrong with your food.  They are very quick to correct. Hint 2:  as soon as you get your burger with endless fries, order more fries as they come out very quickly and are very hot.  Better than the ones that come with your burger..  But do not wait until you our of fries to order, you will want more and they are supper good hot. We will not be back for happy hour, but will come back for dinner thanks to Lidia and her manager.

It's a red Robin right? Classic americana in a super casual almost cafeteria style. We've had good experiences here before with decent service and okay food (with kids there are not that many options in sleepy Des Moines) but tonight we ordered to go. Since the order was placed online the item list should have been clear...But we ended up without our drinks, silverware, and even dressing for the salad. The chicken BBQ wrap had a large bone still in and was undercooked. The salmon salad had wilted lettuce and didn't come out of the kitchen until far after our scheduled pick up time. Not terrible bit not the best experience by far.

This location is my fave - the food is always good and the staff is incredible!  Got the smokey tavern burger for only $6.99. Good size if you don't want to eat one of the bigger royal burgers. My boyfriend got the royal red robin burger and said it was cooked well and the egg was just the way he wanted it. Fresh endless fries with delicious free dips is always nice. I enjoyed my visit here :)

We are regulars and service is always hit and miss.  Today's service was blah, the guy was not focused, like we were a burden and he had other things to do.  I don't know if waiters realize that they are can make or break an experience.

My friend and I decided to stop here for a late lunch after spending some time at the marina. I have never experienced such bad service at a bar. We were the only two sitting at the bar. If I could give zero stars I would. After ordering our food we were never asked if we wanted a different beverage then water(we did) also once our food was dropped off we were left stranded. No one came to give us napkins. I had to ask a different server in the area for napkins. Our waters were never filled. I also asked multiple servers if they could grab us some sauce for our fries. They then delivered the sauce once we were done eating. I understand they said something about a shift change. But our original bartender never said he was clocking out and the new bartender on shift never completed our service. The new bartender was yelling over the bar and had servers behind the bar. Then came back up to us and said "was I grabbing you something?" Yes 15 minutes ago you were but we would like the check now thank you. We won't be stopping here anymore. As a manager myself, I wouldn't be scheduling these individuals alone as they are not capable of handling a shift change properly.

Red Robin... you blew it this time.  I was in on 9/15/2017 at about 4:15pm, Table 40.   One dish I go to your restaurant for is the Ensenada Chicken Platter.  I appreciate this low-cal option and usually get the 1 breast option instead of 2....Honey Mustard on the salad.   I knew exactly what I wanted and it was my Server who seated me.  I asked for a 22oz Samuel Adams Boston Lager and a single breast Chicken Ensenada Platter.  I waited and waited for my beer.  ....and waited some more. Before I knew it my Chicken Ensenada Platter came out...but still no beer.   I finally got my beer when my entree was half way consumed.  Oh, by the way....they forgot the honey mustard dressing for the salad.   Basically I was through with m entree and had 3/4th  of a 22 ounce beer left.  Something certainly slipped with service.  My Server apologized for the delay with the beer and made a comment about the bar area being so busy.  Well excuse me.  It's Friday at the end of the work week.  Staff accordingly.  I've worked in the luxury hotel business for 37 years and I know on occasion we'll mess up.  It's inevitable.  What makes the difference is the recovery.  Feel free to reach out to me and recover.

Posting because it can't be said enough... The service at this place is awful. I see there are a few positive reviews about servers, but they are a rare find in the vast sea of incompetence known as the Des Moines Red Robin. Either that or the good ones leave for greener pastures.  Oh and the food.. it's Red Robin. It's fine.

My wife and I went here for lunch. They didn't get our drinks out till it was 35mins I to the meal. No napkins or utensils. Asked for ranch got that 16mins later. Server didn't bother to come look at the table. Bs place not goin here anymore.

My experience was great! Stephanie was my server in the bar tonight and did a great job! Only thing I didn't like was the new veggie patty . It was pink. No one wants to eat pink meat especially a vegetarian!

I like this location because it's right near the water! The service here is okay, hit or miss sometimes depending on who's working. I normally order their Salmon dinner with broccoli dipped with ranch! Yum.
omg...red robin has the best burgers ever!!!! the whiskey bourbon bbq...mm...mm... good!!!

I have no idea why this specific RR has low scores. All I can say is that we had a wonderful experience. Better than our own Red Robin!!! Service was nice, perfectly paced, and our food was prepared exactly how we wanted it (which means we had a lot of "needs" lol) she was even right on with the refills of raspberry Lemon-aid, and hot water for tea! Great job! I hope you can redeem yourself in your locals eyes!

Okay, it's Red Robin. You're not going to find Michelin star worthy food here and it probably won't blow your mind, but it's Red Robin. The food is decent (pretty good when you want something heavy) so don't expect the place to have 4.5 stars+ on Yelp. I sat at the bar during dinner time because it was pretty busy in the main dining room. Got the menu and then it took a pretty long time for the bartender to get back to us to take our menu. She was off on her own in the beginning and didn't return to the bar for a while. We weren't in a rush though, but it was longer than I would have wanted to order food. I always get the short stack of onion rings here ($5 appetizer menu). It comes with six onion rings and the campfire and ranch sauce for dipping. Out of all the locations, I think this place did not do a good job in making the onion rings. The fried batter was just falling off the ring, and it was falling apart completely. It was never like this at other locations. I enjoy the tavern menu here because the burgers are smaller than the regular burger menu. Because the fries are bottomless (aka unlimited), I don't need a huge burger to fill me up. In fact, the tavern leaves me feeling pretty full by the end of it. If you like the tavern, you can make them bigger for an additional charge. They come up with different style taverns, and I tried the taco one. It comes with guacamole, salsa, and tortilla strips inside. I didn't taste the strips (I wonder if they turned into mush from all the sauces inside?). The guacamole was good, but I wish there was more. The salsa wasn't very potent, just subtle. Fries came out crisp and I dipped mine in honey poppy (the good stuff!). The bartender came back toward the latter half of dinner and was very attentive from then on. She filled our water, asked us if we needed anything several times throughout our dinner and was available if we needed her.  Checking out is simple now that they use the little electronic pads at each table. You can split the bill easily as well and then head on out as soon as your done! No more flagging down a waiter and waiting for your check, hurray! Overall, food was pretty good and service was decent. I still come back for the endless fries time after time. Guilty pleasure, ya know?

Wait time is alright. Customer service, alright. However food, always good. And always a great place to meet with my little family and all the kids... especially for their bottomless fries we can never get enough of! Convenient and by the water. We love it there!

I don't come into a Red Robin expecting amazing food but I was at the one in Covington recently and the food I had there was significantly better than here. I ordered the same thing at both places (veggie burger, garlic fries) but here the fries were way too oily and soggy and the burger seemed a bit... mushed? Dented? Being served our entrees nearly an hour after we sat down didn't help either, though in fairness it did seem pretty busy for a Thursday evening. Service was friendly and nice however.
